array.name: faq_functions_examples
array.item: sin(x) - the sine of x \nExample: \'sin(45)\'
cos(x) - the cosine of x \nExample: \'cos(45)\'
tan(x) - the tangent of x \nExample: \'tan(45)\'
cot(x) - the cotangent of x \nExample: \'cot(45)\'
asin(x) - the arc sine of x \nThe result is in the interval [-pi/2,pi/2](or [-90,90], depends on the mode) \nExample: \'asin(0.5)\'
acos(x) - the arc cosine of x \nThe result is in the interval [0,pi](or [0,180], depends on the mode) \nExample: \'acos(0.5)\'
atan(x) - the arc tangent of x \nThe result is in the interval (-pi/2,pi/2)(or (-90,90), depends on the mode) \nExample: \'atan(33)\'
acot(x) - the arc cotangent of x \nThe result is in the interval (0,pi)(or (0,180), depends on the mode) \nExample: \'acot(33)\'
sinh(x) - the hyperbolic sine of x \nExample: \'sinh(25)\'
cosh(x) - the hyperbolic cosine of x \nExample: \'cosh(25)\'
tanh(x) - the hyperbolic tangent of x \nExample: \'tanh(32)\'
coth(x) - the hyperbolic cotangent of x \nExample: \'coth(32)\'
pow(x, y) - x raised to the power of y \nExample: \'pow(3, 2)\'
sqrt(x) - positive square root of x \nExample: \'sqrt(2)\'
exp(x) - e raised to the power of x \nExample: \'exp(2)\'
log(x, y) - the base x logarithm of y \nExample: \'log(3, 9)\'
ln(x) - the natural logarithm of x \nExample: \'ln(5)\'
log10(x) - the base 10 logarithm of x \nExample: \'log10(5)\'
abs(x) - the absolute value of x \nExample: \'abs(-2)\'
floor(x) - the largest integer which is less than or equal to x \nExample: \'floor(23.3)\'
ceil(x) - the smallest integer which is more than or equal to x \nExample: \'ceil(23.3)\'
min(x, y) - the smallest of x and y \nExample: \'min(3, 4)\'
max(x, y) - the largest of x and y \nExample: \'max(5, 6)\'
random() - a random number greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1 \nExample: \'random()\'
round(x) - the closest integer to x \nExample: \'round(5.5)\'
signum(x) - 0 if x = 0; 1 if x greater than 0; -1 if x less than 0 \nExample: \'signum(-2)\'
fact(x) - the factorial of x where x is a non-negative integer \nExample: \'fact(5)\'
mod(x, y) - x mod y; the result is always positive \nExample: \'mod(7, 5)\'

array.name: faq_variables_examples
array.item:
x = 2; 
y = sin(3 * cos(25) * min(3, 2)) 
z = x + y 
d = x * z
mass = 35 \nspeed = 3e8 \nenergy = mass * pow(speed, 2)

gravity = 6.674e-11 
m1 = 25 
m2 = 35 
dist = 1000 
force = gravity * m1 * m2 / pow(dist, 2)

array.name: faq_constants_examples
array.item: pow(pi, 2)
exp(e)
